content:
Flo'dan gelen talep üzerine Initial Allocation bünyesinde bir paket mekanizması geliştiriliyor.

Şu anda ürün kümeleri ile birebir aynı yapıda olacak şekilde tasarlandı. Paket isimleri, pakete ait etiketlerin isimleri ve üyelikler üzerinden kayıtlar oluşturuluyor.

Kullanıcının ileride paket yaratabilmesi gerekiyor. Bu işlemin kolay gerçekleştirilebilmesi adına yeni oluşturulan pakete şimdilik sadece isim verilmesi, alt paketlerin sayısı ve isimleri aynı olacak.

### Arayüz

Paket düzenleme arayüzü sürükle-bırak ile yönetilen ekran temel alınarak geliştiriliyor. En önemli problem pakete dahil olmayan generic sayısının çok fazla olması. 160 bin adet "draggable" nesne arayüze fazla yük bindiriyor. 15 dakika sayfanın yüklenmesi sürüyor, out of memory hatasına kadar gidebiliyor. Paketsiz ürünleri jq-ui autocomplete widget yardımıyla ekrandan kaldırma ve sadece adı yazılan generic için bir draggable oluşturma yoluna gitmeliyiz.

ıyla ekrandan kaldırma ve sadece adı yazılan generic için bir draggable oluşturma yoluna gitmeliyiz.

Ürünlerin paketler içerisine yerleştirilme işlemi sonrasında tanımlılık ekranına bu paket bilgisinin bir şekilde getirilmesi gerekli.

Bunları SalesHistory_DVM class'ı içinde "SalesData_DVM<Store, string>[] sales" şeklinde tanımlı arrayde tutuyoruz.Devam ürünü kararı vermemiz için kriter: son 18(parametrik) içerisinde 14(parametrik) ila 28(parametrik) gün arası satış veya stok datası olan ürün-mağaza ikililerini devam olarak değerlendiriyoruz.Kullanılan Parametreler:* MonthsSinceContinuationHistoryStart : Kaç ay öncesinden itibaren dataya bakaçağız.* ContinuationMinimumDays : Bir ürün-mağaza ikilisi için minimum kaç satış veya stok noktasını devam kabul edeceğiz.* ContinuationMaximumDays : Bir ürün-mağaza ikilisi için maksimum kaç satış veya stok noktasını devam kabul edeceğiz.NOT: Parametreler IA için arayüzde yer almıyor henüz.NOT: Ürünleri devam pathini kullanmadan doğrudan yeni pathine sokmanın parametrik bir yolu bulunmasa da MonthsSinceContinuationHistoryStart parametresinin 0 yapılması gibi workaround yollar kullanılabilir.Kullanılan SP'ler:  *  GetProductStoreSalesHistory_DVM : Yukarıda anlatılan şekilde dev

llanılabilir.Kullanılan SP'ler:  *  GetProductStoreSalesHistory_DVM : Yukarıda anlatılan şekilde devam ürün-mağazalarını getiren SP.                                                         Sonuç olarak ürün-mağaza ikilisi için bakılan aralıktaki şu çıktıları vermektedir:                                                        - SaleStartDate (ilk satış tarihi)                                                        - Days (Toplamda kaç gün satışının olduğu)                                                        - IntervalSale (Toplam satış adedi)
- Forecastingden hangi mağaza ürünler için sonuç çıkıyor? Kaç satır sonuç çıkmasını bekliyor (=N or <=N) hangi çıktı hangi tabloda? Tüm ürün-mağaza ikilileri (=N) için forecast çıkıyor. Sonuçlar initialallocation.ForecastResults tablosuna yazılıyor.
- Forecasti etkileyen hangi parametreler var?
- Forecasting değerini etkileyen diğer tablolar neler? (multipliers vs)

eyen hangi parametreler var?
- Forecasting değerini etkileyen diğer tablolar neler? (multipliers vs)
- Forecastten çıkan sonuç ne kadarlık dönemin forecasti? haftalık / günlük vs ?Haftalık
- Yeni mağazaların forecastlerinin path i nasıl? kodun neresinde ayrılıyor?İlk defa açılacak bir mağaza ise referans mağaza üzerinden hesaplama yapıyoruz. 1-2 haftalık mağaza gibi durumlar için "mağaza açılış tarihi" kullanılarak geliştirme yapılabilir.
- Referansı olan ürünlerin path i nasıl ?Bir ürünün referansı varsa her durumda öncelikle referansına bakarak forecast üretiyoruz. Referans'ı olan ürünler için ayrı bir path yok.

## IA targets

eransına bakarak forecast üretiyoruz. Referans'ı olan ürünler için ayrı bir path yok.

## IA targets

- Forecastten çıkan tüm pairlere IA target çıkmasını bekliyor muyuz?Evet. Buradan görülebilir.
- IA targets ı etkileyen parametreler / tablolar neler?
- Targetlar hangi tabloya yazılıyorDetailedResults tablosu altında TargetAmount olarak görülebilir.
- Parametre ile dışarıdan bir target kullanmasını sağlayabiliyor muyuz?Parametre ile yapılamıyor. Dolaylı olarak şu şekilde yapılabilir. Bir run aldıktan sonra forecastler editlenip, run tekrarı sırasında ReuseLastForecast parametresi açılır.

## Raw Need (Target-(Plan Stok))

lenip, run tekrarı sırasında ReuseLastForecast parametresi açılır.

## Raw Need (Target-(Plan Stok))

- Plan stoğun içinde neler var? (mağaza stok yolda stok, en son verilen rep karar? en son verilen kritik stok tamamlama kararı? )Mağaza Stoğu + Incoming Stok + aynı günün Replenishment Adedi. (Flo için + gün içindeki önceden gerçekleşmiş ve onaylanmış IA sonuc adetleri toplamı)
- Plan stoğu çeken SP nin adı ve içeriği nedir?GetStockData: Çıktı olarak:                        - StoreCode                        - ProductCode                         - Stock                        - IncomingStock                        - ReplenishmentStock                        - IAAccptedIncomingStock (Sadece Flo'da)

## Multipack need (Raw Need with MultiPack Constraints)

- Paketi olanlar için yukarı yuvarlama ya da aşağı yuvarlama nasıl yapılıyor?Buradan Görülebilir
- Kullanılan parametreler / tablolar nedir?Buradan Görülebilir. Resim üzerinden anlaşılabilir.

bilir
- Kullanılan parametreler / tablolar nedir?Buradan Görülebilir. Resim üzerinden anlaşılabilir.

## Asorti need (Multipack with asorti constraints)

- asorti algoritmasının kullandığı parametre ve tablolar nelerdir?
- tüm ürünler asorti algoritmasına giriyor mu?Hayır, sadece tanımlı asortisi olan ürünler giriyor. Buradan Görülebilir.

## Depo Stok'a göre elenmesi

- Hesaplanan ihtiyaç depo stoğuna göre nasıl eleniyor?Önceliklendirmeye göre depo stoğu dağıtılıyor.
- Öncelik hesaplama algoritması nedir?Buradan Görülebilir.
- Tekli depo stoğu ve asortili depo stoğu nasıl ele Öncelikle dağıtabildiğimiz ürünleri asortili olarak dağıtıyoruz. Kalan ürünleri tekli olarak dağıtıyoruz.

# ------------------------------------------------------------------------

# IA Flow Chart

Bu kısımda flow chartlar ile genelden özele Initial Allocation algoritmasının akışı anlatılmaktadır.

Bu kısımda flow chartlar ile genelden özele Initial Allocation algoritmasının akışı anlatılmaktadır.

| Gösterim | Açıklama |
| --- | --- |
| AP | Arrived Product |
| SP | Stored Procedure |
| DVM | Devam ürünü |
| WH | Warehouse |
| Yeşil Text | Parameter name |
| Mavi Text | Stored Procedure name |
| Turuncu Text | Table name |

## Genel Akış

Initial Allocation algoritması kısıtlardan bağımsız olarak forecast yaptığımız ve kısıtları/kuralları uygulayarak dağıtım kararlarını verdiğimiz iki temel kısımdan oluşuyor.

### 1.Calculate Forecast Results

IA'ya girecek tüm ürün-mağaza ikilileri için haftalık forecast'in yapıldığı yerdir.

#### 1.1. Find Sales For Periods

Bu kısımda ürün ve mağaza tanımlılıklarından bağımsız olarak iki farklı periyot (Last8Weeks and UserDefinedPeriod) için satış geçmişi getirilir.

Satış datası Model, H1H4, H1H3 ve H1H2 seviyelerinde getirilir, tek bir obje içerisinden tüm seviyelere erişilebilir.

#### 1.2. Find Sales For DVM

rinde getirilir, tek bir obje içerisinden tüm seviyelere erişilebilir.

#### 1.2. Find Sales For DVM

Bu kısımda ürün ve mağaza tanımlılıklarından bağımsız olarak iki farklı periyot için (DefaultPeriod(18 ay şu anda) ve UserDefinedPeriod) devam niteliklerini taşıyan ürün-mağaza ikilileri getirilir (dağıtıma girecek ürünler arasında).

Sonuç olarak ürün-mağaza ikilisi için bakılan aralıktaki şu çıktıları vermektedir:
- SaleStartDate (ilk satış tarihi)
- Days (Toplamda kaç gün satışının olduğu)
- IntervalSale (Toplam satış adedi)

#### 1.3. Get Options

Burada optionları çekmek için GetArrivedOptions isimli SP kullanılıyo. Bu SP optionları ve referanslarını birlikte getiriyor. SP'nin çalışırken kullandığı tablolar ve sonucu ile ilgili bir örnek aşağıdadır.

#### 1.4. Get Stores For 'option'

Burada elimizdeki option için tanımlaması olan mağazaları getiriyoruz. Bunun için GetArrivedOptionsForStores isimli bir SP kullanılıyor. Bu SP OptionsForStores isimli tablodan data çekip, Operations.Products ve Operations.Stores ile inner joinliyor. Sonuçta temel olarak data arayüzdeki tanımlama  'Ürün Mağaza Tanımlılıkları' ekranı üzerindeki tanımlılıklara göre geliyor. Yukarıdaki örneği devam ettirecek olursak:

Algoritmanın bu aşamasında verilen option için yukarıdaki tabloda tanımlı store'lar çekiliyor.
Özetle bir option alıp, mağaza listesi döndürüyoruz. Algoritmada bu listeyi bir loop içerisinde dönüyoruz.

#### 1.4. Get AP's in 'option'

GetProductArrivals isimli SP bize dağıtıma giren tüm ürünleri veriyor. Bu ürünler arasından elimizdeki 'option'ın ürünlerini getiriyoruz.
Özetle bir option alıp, ürün listesi döndürüyoruz. Algoritmada bu listeyi bir loop içerisinde dönüyoruz.

#### 1.5. is DVM option

Burada isDVM kararı verirken elimizdeki 'option'ın daha önceden "1.2. Find Sales For DVM" adımında çektiğimiz datanın içerisinde olup olmadıgına bakıyoruz.

#### 1.5. Calculate SKU Forecast

adımında çektiğimiz datanın içerisinde olup olmadıgına bakıyoruz.

#### 1.5. Calculate SKU Forecast

Option bazında devam ürünü kararını verdiğimiz ürünler içi SKU (bizim için product) bazında forecast hesaplaması yapıyoruz. Burada da son aşamada product bazında devam olmadığına bakarak hesaplama yapıyoruz.

#### 1.6. Calculate Option Forecast

Option bazında devam ürünü olmayan ürünler için forecasti option bazında hesaplıyoruz. Forecast'i hesaplarken karar seviyesi olarak olabildiğince alt seviyelerden başlamaya çalışıyoruz. Daha önce satış datasını çekerken thresholdlarla hesapladığımız değerler arasında Model seviyesinden H1H2 seviyesine kadar çıkabiliyoruz.

#### 1.7. Forecast post-process

[Initial Allocation Algorithm Update]

### 2. Calculate Allocation

Forecast datası göz önünde bulunularak, tüm kısıtlar ve operasyon kurallarını kullanarak dağıtım kararlarının verildiği yerdir.

#### 2.1. Calculate Needs

e operasyon kurallarını kullanarak dağıtım kararlarının verildiği yerdir.

#### 2.1. Calculate Needs

Bu kısımda forecast ve confidence level bilgilerini kullanarak ürün-mağaza bazında karar(target) hesaplıyoruz. Sonrasında bu karardan mağazadaki miktarı çıkararak gerçek ihtiyacı (need) hesaplıyoruz.

#### 2.2. Apply Package Constraints

Bu kısımda paketli olarak dağıtılabilecek toplam adet hesaplanıyor. Algoritma yapımızda bu bilgi Order sınıfının bir field'ı olarak ele alınıyor. Algoritmanın büyük bir kısmı need'e tam bölünmeyen paketlerde aşağı/yukarı yuvarlama ile alakalı.

###

Algoritmanın temel akışını aşağıda şemada görebilirsiniz. Detaylı anlatımı da devamındadır.

pply Data

Bu kısımda algoritmda ve dokumanda sıkça kullanılan Supply Data özelliği açıklanmaktadır.

SupplyData IA sırasında dağıtacağımız ürünlerin arrival miktarları ve depodaki miktarlarını RunId bazında tuttuğumuz tablo. Bu tabloya her run'da sadece 1 kere olmak üzere ekleme yapıyoruz, ihtiyacımız olduğu zaman RunId ile tablodan ulaşabiliyoruz. Tabloya yeni dağıtım için ürünlerin bilgisini RefreshSupplyData isimli bir SP kullanarak yapıyoruz, data çekme işlemini ise GetSupplyData isimli SP ile yapıyoruz.

Snew would not be included in the list and therefore sales data would not be calculated for this store regardless of forecast period. Exact same forecast would be calculated for store Snew and store Sold.

Same approach is applied to both new store-product pair forecasts as well as continuation forecasts. If the option-Sold is continuation, then so is option-Snew.

# A Better Approach

inuation forecasts. If the option-Sold is continuation, then so is option-Snew.

# A Better Approach

With the task  we now mark the start date of sales for every store and save it as the opening date of the store (default is today). As the sales are calculated for a given period of time in the past, we compare the start date of this period and the opening date of the store. If the opening date is smaller (has been open for a while when the time period starts) the store can use its own sales data and therefore reference store data is ignored. If the store's opening date is too close to or greater than the forecast period's start date, then the reference store is taken into account and sales data for the new store is replaced by the reference store's sale data for the forecast period.

This way, while calculating last 8 weeks forecast, the store can use its own sales data as well as while calculating user defined period forecast, the store can use reference store's sales data.

## Continuation

For now the algorithm will apply the above approach to continuation sales as well. Therefore if a store is not old enough at continuation sales start date, reference store's continuation sales will be used. However, continuation sales are calculated for a wide range of time and therefore there is room for improvement here. For example, if continuation sales start date is 12 months ago, then a store with 6 moths of history could have used its own sales for the period that it has been open.

## Top 5 issue
# Top 5 issue
Top 5 issue
Top 5 issue

- Arrived products and assortments are divided into smaller groups, called deliveries. Each run can distribute single delivery at a time. Run results can be edited and accepted through UI. If a delivery's content changes, runs that distributed them are automatically cancelled.
- Store-Option results can be limited by maximum product and assortment quantities. Currently there aren't any product maximum distribution amounts. FLO sales channel has a maximum assortment distribution amount of 2, while POLARIS sales channel also has maximum assortment distribution of 2.
- Store-Product Group capacity constraints were implemented. Results could be filtered by Store's option capacity as well as product capacity. However, Flo has decided to not use them. Daily capacities will be in effect.
- Orders from outside of Turkey were implemented as manual IA orders for an unused store code. Algorithm would reduce the manual order quantities from available stock before allocating them.

ode. Algorithm would reduce the manual order quantities from available stock before allocating them.
- Different sales channels can sell the same product. Options for store table needs to be maintained separately for every sales channel.

## Pair Selection

## Top 5 Issue

- Options starting with "88" can only be referenced by other options starting with "88". Options which do not start with "88" can only be referenced by other options which also do not start with "88".
- Stock which is not on display is shown as store stock. Continuation forecast shouldn't reference to months without sales.
- Not every product in operation.Products is valid. Some products/sizes are not produced and considered invalid entries while calculating size ratios.
- Model codes are one of the most important key values. New-pair forecasting finds reference sales at H1H4-Model level. Store confidence levels can be adjusted by Store-H1H4-Model.
- Some products do not have H4.

## Pair Selection

Stored in initialallocation.OptionsForStore table as Option-Store pairs. If the parameter AllocateUndefinedToAllStores was set to True then options with no store pairs in initialallocation.OptionsForStore table would be allocated to every active store. However, for Mavi this parameter is set to False.

### Active Products

All products that are in initialallocation.ValidSizes table are active products. If an option has no sizes defined in this table, then the following rules apply:

1. Count the sizes of the option in operation.Products table
2. If the count is greater than 1, then all sizes except for empty size are valid
3. If the count is one, then that size is valid

All products that are in initialallocation.BlockedProducts are eliminated.

### Active Stores

valid

All products that are in initialallocation.BlockedProducts are eliminated.

### Active Stores

All stores that are in initialallocation.Stores table are valid stores. All stores that are in initialallocation.BlockedStores where TargetDate is between StartDate and EndDate are eliminated.

### Active Pairs

Since UseOptionsForStoreDates parameter for Mavi is set to False, every option in initialallocation.OptionsForStore table is an active pair.

## Reference Stores and Reference Options

If initial allocation forecast calculation process can be written as F(s, o) = r where s is store, o is option and r is the forecast result, then defining a reference option (ro) for o would mean replacing value of o with ro before calling F(s, o) and therefore calling F(s, ro) instead. The result of F(s, ro) is used for the (s, o) pair.

Same goes for the reference stores. Defining a reference store (rs) for s would mean replacing value of s with rs before calling F(s, o) and therefore calling F(rs, o) instead. The result of F(rs, o) would be used for the (s, o) pair.

o) and therefore calling F(rs, o) instead. The result of F(rs, o) would be used for the (s, o) pair.

If a store-option pair (s, o) has reference store and reference option, then F(rs, ro) is called and result is used for the (s, o) pair.

Reference store data is stored in initialallocation.ReferenceStores table. Users can update this table using Reference Stores page.

Reference option data is stored in initialallocation.ReferenceOptions table. Users can update this table using Reference Products page.

### Store Aging

As a new store starts to age, it produces its own sales data. After a certain amount of time, the store's own sales can be used, for example, to get last 8 weeks reference sales (more details regarding what reference sales are can be seen in the new pair forecasting section below). Every referenced period has a start and end date, which allows us to set a certain age for a store to ignore the reference store sales and use its own, if the store is old enough at the start date of this period. The MinimumNewStoreHistory parameter is used to set the age (in days) required to prefer the store's own sales instead of the reference store's sales. If the store has made its first sale in a date later than (StartDate - MinimumNewStoreHistory), then reference store is effective. If the store has made its first sale in a date earlier than (StartDate - MinimumNewStoreHistory), reference store's sales are used. For Mavi, this parameter is set to 30.

- MinimumNewStoreHistory), reference store's sales are used. For Mavi, this parameter is set to 30.

## Forecasting

There are currently 2 separate forecast calculation methods implemented. First, new pair forecast, is for new Store-Option pairs that do not have a history of days with sales or stock. Second, continuation forecast, is for Store-Option pairs that already have a history of days with sales or stock.

The results of forecasting are stored to the initialallocation.ForecastResults table.

- Takes priority over new pair forecast: If a Store-Option pair has continuation forecast, then the new pair forecast for the pair is disregarded.This means that a Store-Product may not be a continuation pair even though the same product's Store-Option pair is a continuation pair. For such pairs, we calcualte an average option forecast using the continuation products' sales and their size ratios, then multiply this average with the non-continuation product's size ratio to get Store-Product forecast.

multiply this average with the non-continuation product's size ratio to get Store-Product forecast.
- Consists of 2 weighted sales, each from a given period: Last months continuation sales and user defined period continuation sales. If one of them does not have any sales available, then the weight is shifted to periods with sales available.Last months period is from (TargetDate - MonthsSinceContinuationHistoryStart months) to TargetDate where TargetDate and MonthsSinceContinuationHistoryStart are parameters. For Mavi, MonthsSinceContinuationHistoryStart is set to 18.User defined period is from ReferenceStartDate and ReferenceEndDate where  ReferenceStartDate and ReferenceEndDate are parameters, provided by the user at the run start through UI.Sale/Stock data by Store-Product-DateDefault weight parameters are ContinuationLastPeriodWeight and ContinuationUserDefinedPeriodWeight.

- There are various filters applied (to all of the periods since the same stored procedure is used with different date ranges given) while collecting continuation sales.ContinuationUseSeasonalSales: Filters out sales that occured when products' season was over. Season date range is taken from model.Seasons table, SeasonBeginningDate and SeasonEndDate columns.UseOutletChangeDates: Filters out sales that occured when products' outlet status has changed. (Currently not in use. Implemented for Flo.)ReplaceOutliers: Replaces outlier sales within the period with their corresponding average sale. Outlier sales data is taken from data.OutlierSales tableContinuationMinimumOptionSizeAvailability: Selected days must have enough sizes of the option available to pass this filter. ContinuationMaximumOptionSizeAvailabilitySales: If option sells this many within a year-month, the filter above is not applied.

zeAvailabilitySales: If option sells this many within a year-month, the filter above is not applied.
- From the filtered sales and stock data, between ContinuationMinimumDays and ContinuationMaximumDays days are selected.
- ContinuationMinimumForecast parameter is used to define a minimum forecast for continuation pairs. For Mavi, this parameter is set to zero.

- Using similar (reference) Options' sales in a Store, forecast is calculated as average weekly Store-Reference Option sales.In order to get weekly sales of Store-Options for the past weeks more easily/readily, a table called initialallocation.WeeklySales is used to store data.InventoryPosition sales by Year-Week-Store-Option.To summarize a week's sales into this table, initialallocation.RefreshWeeklySales stored procedure is used.
- Consists of 2 weighted sales, each from a period:Last 8 Weeks Reference Sales is reference sales extracted from weeks within (TargetDate - 56 days) to TargetDate where TargetDate is parameter.User Defined Period Reference Sales is reference sales extracted from weeks within ReferenceStartDate and ReferenceEndDate where  ReferenceStartDate and ReferenceEndDate are parameters, provided by the user at the run start through UI.

enceStartDate and ReferenceEndDate are parameters, provided by the user at the run start through UI.
- Default weight parameters are LastPeriodWeight and UserDefinedPeriodWeight. Their values are 0.6 and 0.4 respectively. They can be overriden by the user, through the configuration UI, where each Store-Product Group can be assigned its own forecast weights.
- If one of them does not have any reference sales available, then the weight is shifted to periods with reference sales available.
- Reference sales of a week will remain the same within the week. Therefore, calculation of a week's reference sales could to be executed only once a week.However, Mavi can update sales data of stores for the past 56 days every day, adding new sales to data.InventoryPosition. This is resolved by calculating weekly sales of the past 8 weeks every day and reference sales every day.

- For a reference period, the following procedure is followed to get reference sales of that periodIf UseLostSales parameter is set to True, lost sales for the weeks in range are added to the weekly sales.If ApplyOptionAvgDaysFiltering parameter is set to True, a Year-Week-Store-Option's sum of day wieghts for days with stock/sales must be higher than MinimumOptionAvgDays parameter. For Mavi, this filtering applied and threshold is 3.0 days.If ApplyOptionAvgDaysScaling parameter is set to True, a Year-Week-Store-Option's weighted days calculated in previous step is less than 7.0, then sales for that week is scaled up by (7.0 / OptionAverageDaysWithStock). For Mavi, this parameter is not set.If ApplyAvailableSizesFiltering parameter is set to True, a Year-Week-Store-Option's sizes which had stock/sale divided by MaximumAvailableSizes must be above MinimumAvailableSizes parameter

which had stock/sale divided by MaximumAvailableSizes must be above MinimumAvailableSizes parameter. For Mavi, this filtering is applied and threshold is 0.5.Maximum sizes for a Store-Option is calculated while updating weekly sales and stored in initialallocation.StoreOptionMaximumAvailableSizeCounts table. This allows stores which did not get all of the valid sizes get their reference sales depending on how many sized they got for the option while previous allocations.If ApplyPriceClusters parameter is set to True, Option's price is used to assign a cluster to the option. Referred options will have to be in same cluster

's price is used to assign a cluster to the option. Referred options will have to be in same cluster. If the parameter is set to False, all Options and Referred Options are in the same PriceCluster (1).If ApplyRateOfSalesClusters parameter is set to True, Option's rate of sales prediction given by the user through the UI is stored and all Referred Options will be in that cluster. If the parameter is set to False, all Options and Referred Options are in the same RateOfSalesCluster (0).If ApplyRateOfSalesClusterFiltering parameter is set to True, the weeks that option's rate of sales cluster is not where it had been the longest is filtered. For Mavi, this parameter is set to False.If ApplyOptionLike88Grouping parameter is set to True, Option's code is used to determine if code starts with 88. If it does, then all the Referred Options will also have to start with 88

ne if code starts with 88. If it does, then all the Referred Options will also have to start with 88. If the parameter is set to False, this matching is ignored by setting Options' and Referred Options' Like88 property to False.If a Store-Option pair does not have at least MinimumReferenceOptionLife weeks, all weeks of Store-Option are filtered. For Mavi, this parameter is set to 2.Remaining sales are candidates to become reference sale of the week, since there will also be percentile thresholds.Cummulative distributions of Store-Option sales of a reference period is used to mark the sales which are above the threshold percentile limit.There are 4 different levels of aggregation where each level has its own percentile threshold

- Each new Store-Option pair tries to find find a set of reference sales for both periods. Reference sales found can be from different levels for the 2 periods (i.e. last 8 weeks reference from model, user defined period reference from hierarchy2).
- Reference sales must satisfy some limitationsMinimumReferenceOptionCount parameter sets a distinct option count for a match level required. If there aren't enough distinct options, then a higher match level is tried. For Mavi, this parameter is set to 1.
- If a reference is not found, the match level is set to NotFound.

### New Pair Forecasting Post-Processing

eference is not found, the match level is set to NotFound.

### New Pair Forecasting Post-Processing

There are 2 post-processes applied to new pair forecast results. First, a clustering is used in order to improve reference sales match level of store-option pairs. Second, the sales percentage limits of store-product groups are taken into account.

#### Store-Product Group Forecast Clustering

If ApplyForecastClustering parameter is set to True, then forecast results go through this process. For details on this post-process, please refer to [this page](https://invent.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IA/pages/99385414/Store-ProductGroup+Forecast+Clustering+PostProcess).

#### Store-Product Group Sales Percentage Limits

ore-ProductGroup+Forecast+Clustering+PostProcess).

#### Store-Product Group Sales Percentage Limits

If ApplyForecastHierarchySalesPercentageLimits parameter is set to True, then forecast results go through this process. For details on this post-process, please refer to [this page](https://invent.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IA/pages/99942401/Store-Product+Group+Sales+Percentage+Limits).

### Scaled Forecast

Scaled forecast is the end result of forecasting process. Therefore, it is calculated for every Store-Product pair. By definition it consists of multiplication of the following values:

- Option Forecast
- Size Ratio
- Multiplier
- Week Effect
- Weekend Coefficient

#### Option Forecast

Forecast of the store-option pair. There are several different sources of option forecast. The list below is the least to highest prior sources.

several different sources of option forecast. The list below is the least to highest prior sources.

- New Pair Result : Average weekly sales of referred options
- Clustered Result : Average weekly sales of referred stores in the cluster
- Hierarchy Sales Percentage Result : Forecast limited by sales percentage.
- Continuation Result : Store-Product's recent sales.

#### Size Ratio

There are 3 different sources of size ratios. The list below is the least to highest prior sources.

- Supply ratios
- H3 size sales ratios
- H4 size sales ratios

Size sales are calculated for all stores and products they sold within the last 12 months. We aggregate the sales by Store-Product Group-Size Code, at several different levels listed in the initialallocation.StoreProductGroupSizeLevels table. Each size's  number of distinct Options that the size is sold through is also stored. This allows the size ratio to be estimated by option.

that the size is sold through is also stored. This allows the size ratio to be estimated by option.

- If an option's all sizes have at least one option that they are sold through, the size ratio can be calculated from those sales asThe sum of (Sales/NrOfOptions) makes up %100 of the size salesSales / SumSales gives the size's ratio
- If not, then the next source is investigated to see if all sizes will have a ratio to them.

#### Multiplier

Floating point forecast coefficients provided by user through the UI. If UseOnlyDefaultMultiplier parameter is set to true, then all multipliers will be set to DefaultMultiplier. Otherwise ( UseOnlyDefaultMultiplier*parameter is set to false* ), data is traversed in the following order until a multiplier is found:

*parameter is set to false* ), data is traversed in the following order until a multiplier is found:

1. ProjectionTyped Store-H4 (if product has a product group hierarchy level of 4)
2. Store-H4 (if product has a product group hierarchy level of 4)
3. Projection Typed Store-H3
4. Store-H3
5. Projection Typed Store-H2
6. Store-H2
7. Projection Typed Store-H1
8. Store-H1
9. DefaultMultiplier parameter

#### Week Effect

For the forecast to be calculated more effectively, algorithm team assigns a multiplier to each week in a year. These multipliers are called week effects and are stored in initialallocation.ForecastWeekEffect table by Store-Hierarchy4-WeekId.

For example, if there is an event in the nearby future, the multiplier can be greater than 1.0, and the weeks following the event can each have a multiplier less than 1.0.

If the week that the TargetDate is in does not have a week effect specified in the table, the DefaultWeekEffect parameter is used.

#### Weekend Coefficient

ek effect specified in the table, the DefaultWeekEffect parameter is used.

#### Weekend Coefficient

Based on the sales statistics of week days, each day is assigned a weight within the week. The default weights of a week day is stored in initialallocation.DefaultDayEffects table. The DayOfWeek column holds the index of the day, where sunday is zero and saturday is six. The weekend coefficient is therefore the sum of Coefficient where the index is 0, 5 and 6 (sunday, friday, saturday). For Mavi, this effect is 0.525411265601008.

This coefficient is used because the initial allocation algorithm calculates a weekly forecast and then only aims to send enough stock to cover 1 weekend.

### Normal Distribution

weekly forecast and then only aims to send enough stock to cover 1 weekend.

### Normal Distribution

Scaled forecast on its own is not enough to calculate a target and distribute products in an optimized fashion. We also need to know how the forecast deviates from the mean. To accomplish this we use a normal distribution model that represents how the sales might deviate from weekly average. For the source of standard deviation parameters, see internal configuraiton section.

- Mean = Scaled Forecast
- Standard Deviation = StandardDeviationScalar + (StandardDeviationMultiplier * (Scaled Forecast ^ StandardDeviationPower))Capped from above by StandardDeviationMaxCapMultiplier * Scaled ForecastCapped from below by StandardDeviationMinCapMultiplier * Scaled Forecast

## Allocation Engine

recastCapped from below by StandardDeviationMinCapMultiplier * Scaled Forecast

- Assorted warehouse stock as well as single warehouse stock is prioritized among the stores. There are several constraints applied to prioritization.If FinishStock parameter or FinishStock allocation preference of product is set to True, then all of the available warehouse stock is prioritized.Default prioritization is the probability of store selling more than the products allocated, multiplied by the product's revenue. If the product does not have a resale price,  DefaultResalePrice parameter is used.While finishing stock, default prioritization method starts to produce zero priority if the final stock of the store gets too large. Due to this, default prioritization is replaced with ScaledForecast/FinalStock prioritization. Later on, the formula is updated to RoughTarget/FinalStock since the rough target of a store is affected by confidence level.We tried implementing different strategies for when this transition occurs

ected by confidence level.We tried implementing different strategies for when this transition occurs. When all stores reach zero priority,  when every store's final stock has past their target amount, and when finish stock is set to true. Currently, the last one is being used and all previous methods no longer exist in code.Usually E-Commerce stores have forecasts much higher than offline stores. The ApplyECommerceTargetCap parameter can be set to True in order to limit the quantity sent to online stores with the highest quantity sent to an offline store

order to limit the quantity sent to online stores with the highest quantity sent to an offline store. For Mavi, this parameter is set to False.If AllocateTopStoresOnly parameter is set to True and TopStoreCount allocation preference is above zero, then only the stores with highest forecast can receive the product.If ApplyECommerceTargetCap parameter is set to True, then for an E-Commerce store to receive stock that carries its final stock above the target amount, there also must be an offline store reaching the same final stock.If there is a store which does not satisfy an allocation preference at the end of prioritization, it is eliminated and the stock for that store is distributed to other stores instead. If such stores are more than one, the one with the least stock allocated and the least forecast is eliminated.

ores are more than one, the one with the least stock allocated and the least forecast is eliminated.
- Assorted warehouse stock is allocated to stores based on assortment parameters (AssortmentItemDistributionThreshold and AssortmentSaleDistributionThreshold), stores' prioritized amounts and their forecast. If FinishAssortedStock is set to true, all assorted stock is distributed.
- If ApplyOptionCapacityConstraints parameter is set to True, the stock limits are taken into account. Any store with enough space for a new option or with option stock can get the products from this run. For Mavi, this parameter is set to False.
- If ApplyProductCapacityConstraints parameter is set to True, the stock limits are taken into account. Any store with enough space for a product can get the products from this run until it runs out of space. For Mavi, this parameter is set to False.

get the products from this run until it runs out of space. For Mavi, this parameter is set to False.
- If ApplyDailyStoreCapacityLimits parameter is set to True, the capacity limits are taken into account. Any store with capacity for the product being allocated can receive any amount. For Mavi, this parameter is set to False.

- Single supply of all warehouses are used to finalize Warehouse-Store-Product orders. There are several constraints applied here. If a store-product can not satisfy these constraints, the Store-Option orders are dropped.If ApplySingleOrderFiltering is set to True and Store-Option does not have any assorted order, then following filters applyIf ApplySingleOrderSizeRatioFiltering parameter is set to true and sum of size ratios available in warehouse is less than SingleOrderMinimumSizeRatio parameter.If ApplySingleOrderAmountFiltering parameter is set to True, then Store-Option pair has to have certain final stock. The stock is determined by the following rulesSingleOrderMinimumAmount parameter is compared to options ValidSizeCount, minimum of the 2 values is used.If Product's Hierarchy3 has a minimum single order amount in the initialallocation.SingleMinimumOrderAmounts table, then the stored value is compared to the above result

ialallocation.SingleMinimumOrderAmounts table, then the stored value is compared to the above result. Minimum of the 2 values is used.If ApplySingleOrderAllSizesFiltering parameter is set to True, then all valid sized must have a final stock above zero.

The results of the allocation are stored to the initialallocation.DetailedResults and initialallocation.DetailedAssortmentResults tables.

Possible improvements:

tion.DetailedResults and initialallocation.DetailedAssortmentResults tables.

Possible improvements:

1. Capacities used are not redacted, meaning the same space can be used again in the following runs. If each run could automatically reduce the amount of stock it has sent from the stores' capacity, then this could become more reliable.
2. Most of the "Filtering" is applied AFTER the prioritization is done. This causes the stock reserved for a store which got filtered later on not to be sent anywhere even if there is need for it elsewhere.
3. Prioritization does not take "which warehouse can stock which store" into account. This can become an issue in the future especially with clients who have stores overseas. May be implemented to prioritize products one warehouse at a time, which also means we won't need MultiWarehouseProductDistribution or MultiWarehouseAssortmentDistribution steps.

## Configuration

Following are the configurations available to users from Configurations page.

### Store Capacities

Currently not in use. Implemented for Flo.

### Multipliers

Users can define a multiplier for Store-Product Group pairs. The multiplier data is stored in initialallocation.Multipliers table. Data is traversed in the following order until a multiplier is found:

1. Store-H4 (if product has a product group hierarchy level of 4)
2. Store-H3
3. Store-H2
4. Store-H1
5. DefaultMultiplier parameter

### Store Labels

Users can assign custom labels for each store, for each decision level. The custom label data is stored in initialallocation.StoreCustomLabels table. The data in this table is shown in Option-Store Definitions page to help users select multiple stores at once using store label filters.

page to help users select multiple stores at once using store label filters.

### Store Forecast Weights

tored in initialallocation.DetailedResults.ConfidenceLevelSource column.

### Store Forecast Weights

Forecast consists of average sales of 2 different periods. For new-pair forecast, there are Last8WeeksReferenceSales and UserDefinedPeriodReferenceSales. These reference sales are averaged using their corresponding weights to get new-pair forecast. For continuation forecast, there are LastPeriodSales and UserDefinedPeriodSales. These sales are averaged using their corresponding weights to get continuation forecast.

The weighted averaging of the sales are implemented in a way that a period which has a weight but does not have a reference sale passes its own weight to other periods which have reference sales.

Users can define a store forecast weight for Store-Product Group pairs. The store forecast weight data is stored in initialallocation.StoreWeights table. Data is traversed in the following order until a confidence level is found:

tion.StoreWeights table. Data is traversed in the following order until a confidence level is found:

1. Store-H4 (if product has a product group hierarchy level of 4)
2. Store-H3
3. Store-H2
4. Store-H1
5. Default weight parametersLastPeriodWeight parameterUserDefinedPeriodWeight parameterFirstWeeksWeight parameter (Currently not in use.)ContinuationLastPeriodWeight parameterContinuationUserDefinedPeriodWeight parameter

### Store Allocators

Store allocators configuration allows UserName-StoreCode pairs to be stored in initialallocation.StoreAllocators table, which allows those users to see initial allocation results of those stores in Results page. For this functionality to take effect, however, UseStoreAllocators parameter must be set to True.

## Internal Configuration

Following are the configurations available to users of role InventAdmin from Internal Configurations page.

### Standard Deviation

ns available to users of role InventAdmin from Internal Configurations page.

### Standard Deviation

Users can define a set of standard deviation parameters for Store-Product Group pairs. The standard deviation parameters data is stored in initialallocation.StandardDeviationParameters table. Data is traversed in the following order until a set of parameters is found:

1. Reference Store - H4
2. Store - H4
3. Reference Store - H3
4. Store - H3
5. Reference Store - H2
6. Store - H2
7. Reference Store - H1
8. Store - H1
9. Default set of parameters (StandardDeviationMaxCapMultiplier, StandardDeviationMinCapMultiplier, StandardDeviationMultiplier, StandardDeviationPower, and StandardDeviationScalar. For Mavi, these are set to 2.0, 0.0, 1, 0.5, 0.0, and 1.0 respectively.)

Note that for reference store standard deviations to be used, UseReferenceStoreStdDevParams parameter must be set to True. For Mavi, this parameter is set to True.

## Result Approval

evParams parameter must be set to True. For Mavi, this parameter is set to True.

## Result Approval

Users can specify a list of Option codes in the results page while accepting run results. This list is stored in initialallocation.AcceptedRunIdOptionPairs table. There are no mechanics implemented in the UI that will prevent user from "accepting" results of subsequent runs that allocated the products of the same option as the previously accepted runs.The pairs in this table are then used for reporting purposes.

## Basic Concepts

Most commonly used terms and their descriptions

Model       : In textile, all products with the same model code has same overall features and design.
        Option      : All products with the same option code has same design, material/color and they only differ by size.
        Product    : A distinct size of an option.

Some customers' data allows concatenation of codes to get from one code to another. Here are some examples:

OptionCode = ModelCode + ColorCode

ProductCode = ModelCode + ColorCode + SizeCode

However, this code concatenation is NOT VALID FOR ALL customer data.

4. ve 5. case'de sorun yok. Her iki dönem için de cluster yaparak bir ortalama çıkartıyorum. Ancak 2. ve 3. durumlarda biraz kafa karışıklığına sebep oluyor. Örneğin Case 2 için L8W satışlarından gelen bileşeni koruyup sadece UD için bir clusterlamaya gidebilirim. Case 3 için de tam tersi.

Diğer bir seçenek de 2. ve 3. caselerde de her iki dönem için cluster yapmak olabilir. Hangisini uygulayalım? İlkini yapsak sonuçlar daha mantıklı olur gibime geliyor. Mümkün mertebe veriyi korumuş oluruz.

İlk seçeneği yapıyorum. Daha önce konuştuğumuzu unutmuşum. Burada da bu yönde bilgi eksikti. Not almış olduk en azından.Soru 2

ha önce konuştuğumuzu unutmuşum. Burada da bu yönde bilgi eksikti. Not almış olduk en azından.Soru 2

Farklı dönemlerden gelen satışların farklı ağırlıklarla gelmesi durumu var. Ağırlıklar mağaza bazında değişiyor. Case 1 için scaled olmayan forecast result hesaplanırken (L8W satışı *L8W ağırlığı) +  (UD satışı *UD ağırlığı) yapıyoruz. Case 2 için konuşacak olursak, UD bileşeni için cluster yaparken L4 seviyesinde eşleşen diğer mağazaların ortalamasını almam gerekiyor. Ortalamayı her mağazanın  (UD satışı *UD ağırlığı) olacak şekilde alabilirim ya da ağırlıklarına hiç bakmadan (UD satışı) olarak alabilirim. İlkini yaparsam birden fazla defa satışları bölmemek için S2 mağazasına ait ağırlıkları görmezden gelmek gerekebilir. İkincisini yaparsam diğer mağazalardan gelen (UD satışı) ortalamasına S2 mağazasının UD ağırlığı kullanılabilir. Nasıl ilerleyelim? Bence ağırlıksız satış ortalamalarına mağazanın kendi ağırlığını uygulayalım. Biraz daha tutarlı olur gibime geliyor.

satış ortalamalarına mağazanın kendi ağırlığını uygulayalım. Biraz daha tutarlı olur gibime geliyor.

1. ApplyForecastClusterPost-process işleminin uygulanıp uygulanmamasını yönetiyor. Eğer bu parametre kapatılırsa (FALSE olarak kaydedilirse) sistem eski haliyle çalışacak ve post-process işlemlerini gerçekleştirmeyecektir.
2. ClusterMinimumStoreCountHerhangi bir dönemden herhangi bir seviyede ortalama hesaplanırken yeterli mağazanın aynı cluster içerisinde bulunup bulunmadığına bakılıyor. Yeterli sayıda mağaza yoksa cluster'a bakılmaksızın bütün mağazalar arasından geçerli seviyede ortalama alınmaya çalışılıyor. Cluster dışında kalan mağazaları da ortalamaya dahil etmeden önce kaç mağazanın yeterli olacağı bu parametre ile yönetiliyor.

azaları da ortalamaya dahil etmeden önce kaç mağazanın yeterli olacağı bu parametre ile yönetiliyor.
3. ClusterMinimumSignLevelHangi seviyeden itibaren satışların kümeleneceğini ve kümeleme işleminin hangi seviyeye kadar deneneceğini belirtir. Örneğin L1 (H1H2) olarak ayarlanırsa L0 ve L1 seviyesinde eşleşen ürün-mağazalar için önce L4, yoksa L3, o da yoksa L2 seviyelerinde eşleşen mağazalardan ortalama hesaplanmaya çalışılır. Parametre L3 olarak ayarlansaydı L0, L1, L2 ya da L3 olarak eşleşen ürün mağazaları L4 seviyesinden eşleşen mağazalardan ortalama bulmaya çalışacak ve bulamadığında L3'e çıkmayacaktır.Edit: Bu yaklaşım parametre L1 iken doğru fakat daha aşağısında yanlış. Parametre değerinden bağımsız olarak, hangi seviyede eşleştiyse o seviyeye kadar cluster yapılmaya çalışılabilir.  Sence de bu daha mantıklı mı? L0 (NotFound) olan ürün-mağaza için yeterli mağaza sayılı olana kadar her seviyede denemek gerekir gibime geliyor.

Questions for the analyst team in order to have a better understanding of the needs and a deeper insight of the data.

System Summary:

- How many new items are getting into the system? (by year / month / quarter / week).
- Those are innovation items or re-form? How can we separate those items from each other
- Is the product that is going to be the subject of the Initial Allocation a re-form item of a previously existing item?
- What is the current initial allocation percentage of the current system? (warehouse)
- How the company works with new items? Company works with OTB / one-time buying etc.
- When does the replenishment start after initial allocation?

Current Solution Analysis:

- How does the in-stock rate of a new item perform following the launch? Is the in-stock rate of the first month in line with the subsequent periods?
- How the initial allocation amount changes through stores in current system? same for all / changes by store size / store cluster etc.

Solution Analysis:

- To what extent does the new item resemble to its reference items in terms of sales units? (ModelAfter) (if reference item info is available)
- Does the new item have a hot start (selling in high units) just after the launch and subsequently have lower sales units in the following periods?
- Is the store distribution of the new item's sales in line with the store distribution of the item's hierarchy sales? (Objective: item sales is predictable by checking the hierarchy average sales before the initial allocation time)
- Is a minimum amount constraint applied in shipping the initial amounts to the stores? If yes, does this constraints vary depending on the store?
- Does the performance of the initial allocation of new items depend on any attribute of the stores? E.g geographic attributes, footage square etc. example, military stores have high reaction to new protein flavor etc.

### Run methods

- Will IA runs be initiated by users via UI, triggered via Data Transfer or any other method?

### X-Docking

- Is the current allocation operations taking advantage of cross docking?

### Data Availability

- How earlier will the data of initial allocation product, quantity, planning data be available prior to allocation?

### Results

- How will Invent Maps send the initial allocation results?
- What types of initial allocation will be more frequently used? (Standard, delivery, warehouse stock, generic simulation)

### Supply Usage

be more frequently used? (Standard, delivery, warehouse stock, generic simulation)

### Supply Usage

- Are there any constraints to amount of supply initial allocation can use?
- What types of supply will initial allocation be able to use? (Single, Multipacked, Assorted)
- Which warehouses will initial allocation be able to use?

### Warehouses / Countries

- Which warehouse should be used to cover stores ?
- For the customers that have several countries, warehouse code - country matches needed.

- Is the product that is going to be the subject of the Initial Allocation a re-form item of a previously existing item?
- To what extent does the new item resemble to its reference items in terms of sales units? (ModelAfter)
- Does the new item have a hot start (selling in high units) just after the launch and subsequently have lower sales units in the following periods?
- Is the store distribution of the new item's sales in line with the store distribution of the item's hierarchy sales?
- Is a minimum amount constraint applied in shipping the initial amounts to the stores? If yes, does this constraints vary depending on the store?
- How does the in-stock rate of a new item perform following the launch? Is the in-stock rate of the first month in line with the subsequent periods?
- Does the performance of the initial allocation of new items depend on any attribute of the stores? E.g geographic attributes, footage square etc.

# Definitions

Trough = Rough target that has not been rounded up or down.

FSO = Store-Option's Forecast to cover 1 week.

FSP = Store-Product's Forecast to cover 1 week. AKA Scaled forecast.

Fw = Store-Product's Forecast to cover 1 week, without scaling coefficients.

CL = Confidence Level for Store-ProductGroup.

SR = Size ratio of product calculated from sales of all sizes at the Store. Sum of size ratios of an option is always 1.0.

M = Multiplier for Store-ProductGroup.

WE = Week effect of Target Week-Store-ProductGroup

WEC = Weekend coefficient. Extra multiplier for day effects of Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

z = Z value of CL.

SD = Standard deviation

SDM = Standard deviation multiplier

SDP = Standard deviation power

SDS = Standard deviation scalar

# Current Approach

While calculating rough target for a Store-Product pair, the following formulation is in use.

FSP = FSO * SR * M * WE * WEC

SD = SDM * (FSP ^ SDP)

Trough = FSP + (z * SD)

rmulation is in use.

FSP = FSO * SR * M * WE * WEC

SD = SDM * (FSP ^ SDP)

Trough = FSP + (z * SD)

Even though WEC scales forecast in order to cover 1 weekend (most selling 3 days) of a week, it is not used in the calculations of SD at the moment.

Also, when we try to introduce cover periods (in weeks) larger than 1, currently we only change the default multiplier to the cover period.

# Proposed Approach

Create a table to keep cover period (in weeks) by Store-ProductGroup.

Create a table to keep Standard Deviation Parameters by by Store-ProductGroup. These are

- SDM = Standard deviation multiplier
- SDP = Standard deviation power
- SDS = Standard deviation scalar
- MAX = Maximum cap for SD
- MIN = Minimum cap for SD

WE is no longer a single coefficient. If cover period is next n weeks, then we need to use SUM of WEs of the next n weeks to get scaled forecast. However, to get the weekly forecast used in SD, we need to use AVG of WEs of the next n weeks.

cast. However, to get the weekly forecast used in SD, we need to use AVG of WEs of the next n weeks.

FSP = FSO * SR * M * SUM(WEs) * WEC

FW = FSO * SR * AVG(WEs)

SD = SDS + SDM * (FW ^ SDP)

Trough = FSP + (z * SD * sqrt(n))

| Due date |  |
| Key outcomes | Limited results for every store-product pair, optimized allocation. |
| Status |  |

## Problem Statement

Customer has allocation limits for the stores in terms of hierarchy 1 (for textile), hierarchy 2 (for shoes), hierarchy 4 (for accessories). In order to allocate products according to the store shipment limits, initial allocation algorithm must cover the limits during the allocation. It must prioritize the higher limit and also, cut the limitless orders.

## Scope

Must have:

- Should use operation.StoreShipmentLimits table.
- Must have historic limit usage between IA runs.
- Reports for limited orders.
- Limits must be applied after accepting a run.
- Canceling run limits must be deallocated.

Nice to have:

ts must be applied after accepting a run.
- Canceling run limits must be deallocated.

Nice to have:

- Special limits for IA.

Not in scope:

- Limit optimization.

## Problem Statement

Customer wants to allocate some products to all possible stores in given time even if they are not listed in the planned option-store definitions.

## Scope

Must have:

- A store-product pair must be listed in forecast and detailed results tables.

Nice to have:

- Special parameter for organizing activated stores for run.

Not in scope:

- Generalizing the method for all Initial Allocation product users is not in scope.

## Reference materials

- Flo DB Documentation

Flo uses special limits for order shipments that are defined with store, Hierarchy1, Hierarchy2, Hierarchy4 and Box/Hanger product extended property. These constraints are provided via an excel file. (Future development: Provided via UI.) After uploading the file to the system, limits provided by the customer must be applied to the allocation rules. Firstly, replenishment run uses the provided limits and then, every initial allocation run creates its own usage virtually. Accepted runs' limit usage decreased from the related tables.

## New Database Units of the Development

Adding shipment limits to the initial allocation generated 3 stored procedures and 1 table to the system.

g shipment limits to the initial allocation generated 3 stored procedures and 1 table to the system.

| Name | Type | Brief Description | Usage |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| initialallocation.StoreShipmentLimits | Table | Keeps run based conditions including accepted limits, planned limits, run limits during the execution and daily limit. | MAPS & UI |
| initialallocation.GetStoreShipmentLimits | SP | Selects run based limits using the supply data in order to prepare for run. | MAPS |
| initialallocation.GetProductExtendedPropertyValues | SP | Selects product extended property values using supply data. | MAPS |
| initialallocation.ApplyAcceptedRunLimits | SP | Decreases the limits according to accepted amounts via UI. | UI |

## New MAPS Units of the Development

reases the limits according to accepted amounts via UI. | UI |

## New MAPS Units of the Development

Adding shipment limits to the initial allocation generated a new module called "*ApplyShipmentLimitConstraintsModule*". In this module, elimination process is performed with generating related information. At the end, used information is saved to the db.

Also, applying limit constraints required keeping extended property information for products. In order to keep this information, *ProductExtendedProperties* class is generated with all extended property *(not only Box/Hanger)*names and values.

#### ApplyShipmentLimitConstraintsModule

###### Filtering

Main operator of the allocation according to limits.

ipmentLimitConstraintsModule

###### Filtering

Main operator of the allocation according to limits.

Module starts with preparing related data for limit constraints. Using *initialallocation.GetStoreShipmentLimits,*limit information is transferred to a data table. This data table will be used on evaluating current limit, changing remaining limit and saving the run limit information. It is kept in the context due to the future needs (e.g. limit based forecast) and it can be edited.

After obtaining limits for the run, *initialallocation.GetProductExtendedPropertyValues*prepares the products' extended properties and their values. This information will be used on deciding the right limit condition for the order. It is also kept in the context for the future needs but for now, only this module uses this information on IA.

kept in the context for the future needs but for now, only this module uses this information on IA.

With completion of the execution of the prepare internal, decision part starts for the allocation. Orders are evaluated in two sections: Assortment orders and Single orders. Most of time (and most of the customers) assortment orders precedes single orders due to operational rules. So, limit constraints applied to assortment orders before applied to single orders. These perecedence might change in the future.

Limiting assortment orders flow can be represented as:

hese perecedence might change in the future.

Limiting assortment orders flow can be represented as:

Every assortment order is sorted with average profit (descending), assortment code (descending), rough target sum (descending) respectively. Then store information (kept in assortment order), arbitrary assortment content as product code (kept Assortment Content in Item), Box/Hanger property value (using *ProductExtendedProperty* dictionary by giving product code) and product group (kept in option class) is defined inside the loop. These variables are sent as parameters with *CheckOrderLimit* method. Remaining limit for this assortment will be retrieved if there is any definition. Otherwise system behaves normally. (Without limit.)

If there is a limit definition for given properties, checking the limit availability is performed under some circumstances:

inition for given properties, checking the limit availability is performed under some circumstances:

- Limit can be smaller or equal to zero. (Zero condition)
- Limit can satisfy the order. (Satisfy condition)
- Limit cannot satisfy the order. (Re-order condition)

Zero Condition

Order and item limit is set to zero. Limit percentage will be calculated as zero.

Limit percentage will be calculated as limit/original limit *100 = 0.

Satisfy Condition

Limit is set to (limit - order (*AssortmentOrder*AsortmentNumberOfItems*)).

Limit percentage will be calculated as limit/original limit *100.

Re-order Condition

System calculates the best assortment order without overflowing the limit:

Best assortment order = AssortmentNumberOfItems/Limit

Order is set to best assortment order. (Can be zero.)

Limit is set to (limit - best assortment order (best assortment orderAsortmentNumberOfItems*)).

Limit percentage will be calculated as limit/original limit *100.

t orderAsortmentNumberOfItems*)).

Limit percentage will be calculated as limit/original limit *100.

Limiting the single orders follow same rules except the amount use. We can set the run remaining limit by single order amount.

*Limit = Limit - SingleOrderAmount.*

###### Savıng

Saving the limit table at the end of the module is a necessity for tracking and reporting. Evolution of the daily limits will be used on future developments so it is important to keep the good track of the run limit usage. For this, *SaveShipmentLimitsForRun* method is called during the Save Internal Phase. Records are kept in *initialallocation.StoreShipmentLimitsForRun* mapped by run ID.

#### ProductExtendedProperties

###### General

This class is generated specially for the ApplyLimitConstraintsModule. Information given by the customer obligated us to keep extended properties of a product. In db, this data is mapped as:

| Product | Property | Value |
| --- | --- | --- |

ies of a product. In db, this data is mapped as:

| Product | Property | Value |
| --- | --- | --- |

So, Product Extended Properties class kept this form as a continuation of this table. Properties and their values are set as a dictionary, while products and their properties (as a class) is kept as another dictionary. There are two levels while reaching a product's given extended property value.

*Product → ProductExtendedPropertiesProductExtendedProperties: Property → Value*For this module, we only obtain the BoxHanger property.

###### Methods

ProductExtendedProperties: Constructor

GetExtendedProperties: Simple get method. Returns the extended property dictionary.

GetExtendedPropertyValue: Returns the given extended property's value with exception throw system.

AddExtendedProperty: Adds the given extended property name and value with exception throw system.

Ipekyol uses reference sales that are purified from discounted sales. In order to provide this information to reference sales structure,*Ignored Options By Year Week*table is created. This table identifies option codes and their discounted years and weeks for making an elimination while processing the weekly sales. After adding special weeks for the UDP and L8W intervals to be ignored, system ignores the sales that are belong to that year, week and option.

## Instructions

Here is a guide for this system:

1. Markdown team updates the promotion dates and their promotion products two times a year. (This can be performed 3 or 4 times.)
2. By the given script, options to be ignored in discounted years and weeks is added to the table.
3. Weekly sales and the reference sales are calculated according to these information.

Related issuesIPEKYOLIA-105MAPS-2553

content:
Defined options for stores is one of the key inputs for the initial allocation algorithm. Most of the time, this input is taken from the customer and added as a row into the initialallocation.OptionsForStore table. Provided Excel file is not imported into the database because generally, files include many rows so that we can not insert it into the main table completely. (Errors or duplicate rows slow down the operation so we prefer one insert command per every row.) Also, update or delete for some of the options might be required.

## Instructions

A general definition Excel file can be seen as:

1. First of all, option column is copied to another sheet and the duplicate records are eliminated.
2. Delete command is applied to the unique options in order to prevent duplicate records with different time intervals.

="DELETE FROM initialallocation.OptionsForStore WHERE OptionCode = '000000000" & A2 & "';"

Original sheet is opened again and the insert command is applied for all rows.

0000000" & A2 & "';"

Original sheet is opened again and the insert command is applied for all rows.

="INSERT INTO initialallocation.OptionsForStore VALUES('000000000" & B2 & "', '" & A2 & "', 'EXCEL', '2020-01-03', '2020-12-31');"

1. Starting with the delete commands, every delete and insert command is executed on SQL Server Management Studio.

> Info: Commands must be executed per 80.000 rows sequentially. In order to go to 80.000th row, CTRL+G is used. Then using CTRL+Shift+Home, all 80.000 row can be selected from the start. After every execution, selected parts must be deleted.

> Info: In order to apply the formula using 4 given column, pasted formula area must be declared as General  type.

1. Create Reference Sales Tablesİlk aşama olarak ekteki prosedür çağrılarak, dbo.ReferenceSalesByDate ve dbo.SalesByDate tabloları oluşturulup dolduruluyor. Bu prosedür 2-3 saat sürebilir. Prosedürde 2016-2017-2018 yılları hardcoded bulunmakta, daha sonra düzeltilmelidir.
2. UDP vs L8W Sales Comparison Daha önceden oluşturulan dbo.ReferenceSalesByDate ve dbo.SalesByDate tablolarını kullanarak, satış miktarlarını "Last 8 Weeks" ve "User Defined Period" dönemlerindeki miktarları ile beraber getiren prosedür (ekte), modele input olacak verilerin geldiği tablodur. Prosedür düzenlenip kalıcı bir tabloya veriler atılabilir ve daha sonrasında veriler oradan da okunabilir, ancak ben Bahadır'ın daha önce yaptığı şekliyle bırakıyorum. DataAccessten bu prosedür çağrılırsa biraz kalabalık bir sonuç dönüyor aslında.

ekliyle bırakıyorum. DataAccessten bu prosedür çağrılırsa biraz kalabalık bir sonuç dönüyor aslında.
3. Model Input PreparationUDPvsL8W'ten gerekli verileri çekmek için Maps Unified'da, Maintenance projesinde DataAccess yazılması gerekiyor. Bu proje, MAPS-2765-MaintenanceProject branchinde bulunabilir.
4. Model ExecutionMaintenance projesinde modellerin hazırlanması gerekiyor. Gereken class'lar şu anda projede hazır, ancak gerekli metodların sadece imzaları var, içleri boş. Bu noktada MarkdownOptimization projesindeki solver çağırma operasyonları incelenerek benzer bir şekilde geliştirme yapılması gerekiyor. ## Problem Statement

Initial allocation algorithm keeps the consistency of the products in terms of size ratio by limiting the options' (to be allocated) size ratio similar with the available sizes filter. According to these two parameters, options' size ratio that can be selected as reference can not be less than 50% (parameter value is 0.5 for now) of it while the orders in products to be allocated also having 50% (parameter value is 0.5 for now) size of it. Orders' size ratio is controlled by: SingleOrderMinimumSizeRatioand the reference options' size ratio is controlled by: MinimumAvailableSizesparameters.

metadata.title: Calculation of the Size Ratio Using Store Stocks

content:
mumSizeRatioand the reference options' size ratio is controlled by: MinimumAvailableSizesparameters.

Current system calculates the single order minimum size ratio using the supplied size ratio (Run's supply data.) Customer wants this value to be calculated with run's supply data (arrived + warehouse stock) + store stock. Simple example can be seen as:

Here, the green cells indicate that the product is considered as supplied for the size ratio calculation. Red cells generate the difference between old method and the new method. This grid shows the calculation for the one store. This calculation must be performed for every store needs allocation separately.

## Scope

Must have:

- Store stock must be calculated using store stock + incoming stock. (Algorithm already has this calculation.)

Nice to have:

- Accepted run stocks also affect the size ratio. (Algorithm already has this calculation.)

Not in scope:

metadata.title: Adding Projection Type to the Multiplier Definitions

content:
Multipliers are used in initial allocation as scalar values that will affect the scaled forecast result in the end. These values are calculated and defined according to the needs of the customers, special days' effect mirroring and target adjustment in some product groups. Values are kept in the initialallocation.Multipliers table.

Current table has 4 columns

| Store | Product Group | Multiplier | Projection Type |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| S1 | PG1 | 150 | Standard |
| S1 | PG1 | 200 | X |
| S2 | PG1 | 170 | Standard |
| S2 | PG1 | 150 | Y |

Store column keeps the related store code and references operation.Stores table.

Product group column keeps the product group ID. This definition may include level 4, level 3, level 2 or level 1. Deepest hierarchy level in the table is used in the algorithm.

Multiplier column keeps the multiplier value by real multiplier * 100 calculation. This development guarantees the healthy update from the user interface (via Excel).

100 calculation. This development guarantees the healthy update from the user interface (via Excel).

Projection Type column keeps the multiplier type that must be identified according to the customer needs. Mavi uses product classes in order to define different multipliers, D&R is expected to be use publishers for the different multiplier values and in the future, this column may keep various types of definitions.

Adding multiplier types is the first step of the integration for the new design. Also, every customer uses a parameter which keeps the "type of" projection and hence, the method that must be used. This parameter is called *MultiplierProjectionType*and its initial values for the different customers are: *Standard* and *Class.Standard* value is used for customers don't need different multipliers for the same store-product group pairs. These customers have only one unique value for store - product group pair so the old system is used in them.

stomers have only one unique value for store - product group pair so the old system is used in them.

*Class*is currently used for Mavi, to identify products' classes (can be seen in *product extended property values* for the name Class) and their multipliers. Multipliers are divided into two section called *standard* and *degerlendirme*and multipliers are applied according to the class of the product.

*Producer*is currently used for D&R, to identify the specific multipliers generated by the weekly sales of publishers. All hierarchy 2 level product groups are added for *standard* value, then some of the publishers have been added with a calculated multiplier in order to multiply the forecast according to its rate of sale. Refresh mechanism works together with the weekly sale process on Sundays.

rding to its rate of sale. Refresh mechanism works together with the weekly sale process on Sundays.

Multipliers are obtained using initialallocation.GetStoreProductMultipliers SP. After adjusting the tables (insertion of the different projection typed multipliers) and the parameter (naming the parameter for the related customer with a unique name) this procedure must be modified. Scopes related with the new parameter value must be added in an if block and the hybrid parts and tables (temp table creation) must stay out of that scope. Normally, multipliers are returned as a store product pair with the multiplier value but this flow might change in the future to store - product group multiplier value so the procedure must have identity columns with the Initial Allocation Algorithm.

#

# 1.Introduction

## 1.1 Purpose

This is a Requirements Specification document for a new Initial Allocation system for Invent Analytics. We plan to replace the existing MAPS IA system with a brand new system. This document describes the scope, objectives, and goal of the new system. This document is intended to guide the technical design and the implementation of the new system.

## 1.2 Project Summary

Project Name:Project Lead: Ekrem Sekerci

Project Supervisors:Gurhan Kok, Eray Aslan, Mustafa Sahin, Aret Cilingir, Koray Parkin, Kubra Ozlem Erzincanli

Responsible Users: Yigit Uzunoglu, Ilgaz Yuksel

## 1.3 Project Scope

arkin, Kubra Ozlem Erzincanli

Responsible Users: Yigit Uzunoglu, Ilgaz Yuksel

## 1.3 Project Scope

This project's scope is to build a system that calculates the right forecasts and allocation decisions for initial allocation products. Initial allocation products are usually new products or stores that have no sales/inventory history. The results of the system will be updateable via a custom UI. However, details of the UI system is not a subject of this document. KPI reports related to the initial allocation are also not a subject of this document.

# 2. Requirements

## 2.1 Functional Requirements

### 2.1.1 Forecast

#### 2.1.1.1 Inputs

- PredictionStartDate, yyyy-MM-dd
- PredictionEndDate, yyyy-MM-dd
- ForecastPairs, table-like structure with columns [ProductId, StoreId]

#### 2.1.1.2 Outputs

-MM-dd
- ForecastPairs, table-like structure with columns [ProductId, StoreId]

#### 2.1.1.2 Outputs

- ForecastResults, table-like structure with columns [ProductId, StoreId, Date, Forecast]. This data must contain all ForecastPairs and all dates between PredictionStartDate and PredictionEndDate (both included)
- StandardDeviations, table-like structure with columns [ProductId, StoreId, StandardDeviation]. This data must contain all ForecastPairs.
- There shouldn't be any null values in results.
- The system should be able to provide option-store level forecasts, optionally.
- The system should be able to provide referenced products, stores or product-store combinations, optionally.

#### 2.1.1.3 Other Functional Requirements

- The system should be able to use Size Profiles of Stores (at a group of like-options) level (or store-cluster level for like-options)

### 2.1.2 Allocation

#### 2.1.2.1 Inputs

-options) level (or store-cluster level for like-options)

- The system should be able to run for the next N days (Cover Period) starting from today or another day in the future.

- Assortment Allocation Results, table-like structure with columns [AssortmentId, StoreId, Amount]

### 2.1.3 General Functional Requirements

- The system should be able to work with decimal values
- The system should be able to work properly regardless of which cloud provider is used.
- Allocation runs should be able to be triggered from a custom UI
- The Allocation results for runs should be able to be updated and approved from a custom UI

## 2.2 Non-Functional Requirements

### 2.2.1 Forecast

### 2.2.2 Allocation

Ürüne ait stok var mı?

- Oluşturduğumuz script üzerinde StockQuantity, AssortedStockQuantity, ArrivedQuantity ve ArrivedAssortedQuantity kolonlarından takip edilebilir. Ürüne ait herhangi bir stok olmadığında karar oluşmayacaktır.

Target hesaplanmış mı?

- Product – Store için target hesaplanmadıysa karar oluşmayacaktır. Oluşturduğumuz script üzerinde Target kolonundan takip edilebilir.

Eldeki stoğun hepsi dağıtılmış mı?

- Need hesaplanan her pair için priority hesabı yapılıyor ve bu hesaba göre dağılım gerçekleşiyor. Bir pair’a need hesaplanmış olsa dahi, eldeki stok priority değeri yüksek olan diğer mağazalara dağıtıldığı için düşük priority’li pair’lara sipariş oluşturamıyoruz.

- Böyle bir case’de eldeki stoğun tümü dağıtılmış mı diye kontrol etmek gerekir. Oluşturduğumuz script üzerinde TotalFinalSingleAmount ve TotalAssortedAmount kolonlarına bakılabilir.

Opsiyona ait tanımlılık var mı?

alFinalSingleAmount ve TotalAssortedAmount kolonlarına bakılabilir.

Opsiyona ait tanımlılık var mı?

- Dağılıma giren her opsiyon için, dağılımın gerçekleşeceği mağazaları tanımladığımız bir tablo bulunuyor. (initialallocation.OptionsForStore) Bu tabloda opsiyona ait bir tanımlılık bulunmuyorsa dağılım gerçekleşmez.

- Oluşturduğumuz script üzerinden opsiyona ait toplam tanımlılık sayısını DefinedStoreCode kolonundan takip edebiliriz.

Asorti şişkinlik threshold’u aşıyor mu?

- Dağılıma giren her asorti için bir asorti şişkinlik miktarı hesaplanıyor. Parametre olarak belirli olan threshold değeri (AssortmentItemDistributionThreshold) ile kıyas yapılıp, threshold’u aşıyorsak karar oluşturmuyoruz.

- Script üzerinde AssortmentBloatRatio kolonundan asorti için hesaplanan şişkinlik miktarını görebiliriz.

Limit var mı?

sortmentBloatRatio kolonundan asorti için hesaplanan şişkinlik miktarını görebiliriz.

Limit var mı?

- Flo’ya özel günlük olarak müşteri tarafından yönetilen ProductGroup – Store bazlı bir limit yapımız var. Gün içerisinde müşterinin yüklediği maksimum limit miktarı kadar karar oluşturabiliyoruz. Her oluşturulan karar sonrasında limitleri update ediyoruz. Limit kalmadıysa mağazaya need hesaplanmış olsa dahi karar oluşturmuyoruz.

- Script üzerinde ItemLimit kolonundan mağazaya ait (run esnasında hesaplanan) limit miktarını görebiliriz.

Opsiyona ait başka bir asortiden sonuç çıkmış mı?

- Bir opsiyona ait herhangi bir mağazaya kaç asortili sonuç çıkacağını capleyebildiğimiz bir yapımız bulunuyor.  (initialallocation.MaximumDistributionAmountsByStore)

- İlgili mağazaya bir opsiyondan çıkan toplam asortili karar sayısı MaximumAssortmentDistributionAmount değerinden büyük ise ihtiyaç olsa dahi yeni bir karar oluşturmuyoruz.

umAssortmentDistributionAmount değerinden büyük ise ihtiyaç olsa dahi yeni bir karar oluşturmuyoruz.

MinimumDistributionAmount tanımlanmış mı?

- Ürüne ait minimum distribution amount değeri belirtildiyse, dağıtım esnasında hesaplanan PrioritizedAmount değeri üzerinden elenme işlemi gerçekleşebilir.

- Dağıtımda her pair için hesaplanan bir prioritizedAmount değeri var. Stok tek tek mağazalara dağıtılırken her dağıtım işlemi sonrası dağıtılan ürüne ait MinimunDistributionAmount değeri var mı ve elde stok

kalmadı mı kontrolü yapılıyor.

- Sıfırlanan stok miktarı Priority değerlerine göre mağazalara yeniden dağıtılmaya çalışılıyor.

MinimumFinalAmount tanımlanmış mı?

MinimumFinalAmount tanımlanmış mı?

- Kullanılabilir stok tek tek mağazalara dağıtılırken her dağıtım işlemi sonrası dağıtılan ürüne ait MinimumFinalAmount değeri var mı ve elde stok

kalmadı mı kontrolü yapılıyor.

## Reference Stores and Reference Options

If initial allocation forecast calculation process can be written as F(s, o) = r where s is store, o is option and r is the forecast result, then defining a reference option (ro) for o would mean replacing value of o with ro before calling F(s, o) and therefore calling F(s, ro) instead. The result of F(s, ro) is used for the (s, o) pair.

Same goes for the reference stores. Defining a reference store (rs) for s would mean replacing value of s with rs before calling F(s, o) and therefore calling F(rs, o) instead. The result of F(rs, o) would be used for the (s, o) pair.

o) and therefore calling F(rs, o) instead. The result of F(rs, o) would be used for the (s, o) pair.

If a store-option pair (s, o) has reference store and reference option, then F(rs, ro) is called and result is used for the (s, o) pair.

Reference store data is stored in initialallocation.ReferenceStores table. Users can update this table using Reference Stores page.

Reference option data is stored in initialallocation.ReferenceOptions table. Users can update this table using Reference Products page.

### Store Aging

As a new store starts to age, it produces its own sales data. After a certain amount of time, the store's own sales can be used, for example, to get last 8 weeks reference sales (more details regarding what reference sales are can be seen in the new pair forecasting section below). Every referenced period has a start and end date, which allows us to set a certain age for a store to ignore the reference store sales and use its own, if the store is old enough at the start date of this period. The MinimumNewStoreHistory parameter is used to set the age (in days) required to prefer the store's own sales instead of the reference store's sales. If the store has made its first sale in a date later than (StartDate - MinimumNewStoreHistory), then reference store is effective. If the store has made its first sale in a date earlier than (StartDate - MinimumNewStoreHistory), reference store's sales are used. For Mavi, this parameter is set to 30.

- MinimumNewStoreHistory), reference store's sales are used. For Mavi, this parameter is set to 30.
